Draw a line from point [0.0, 0.0] to point [0.75, 0.0]. 2. Draw a line from point [0.75, 0.0] to point [0.75, 0.105]. 3. Draw a line from point [0.75, 0.105] to point [0.6953, 0.105]. 4. Draw an arc from point [0.5672, 0.333] to point [0.1828, 0.333]. * The arc's midpoint is [0.375, 0.675]. 6. Draw a line from point [0.0, 0.105] to point [0.0, 0.0]. *Loop 2:* 1. Draw a circle centered at point [0.375, 0.45] with a radius of 0.075. **Step 4: Extrude Sketch** Extrude the drawn sketch with the following properties: * Extrude depth towards the normal: 0.15 * Extrude depth opposite the normal: 0.0 * Sketch scale: 0.75 The resulting object represents a 3D model of a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side with a center hole. The height is 0.75, and the length and width are also 0.75. This completes the instructions for Part 1.</description>

This rectangle will have six lines and will form a closed loop. 4. Draw a third rectangle on the same plane, shifted down by 0.005 units in the y direction. The line commands for this rectangle are provided in face_3 of the sketch section. This rectangle will have four lines and will form a closed loop. 5. Draw a fourth rectangle on the same plane, shifted to the right by 0.3081 units and down by 0.0001 units in the y direction. The line commands for this rectangle are provided in face_4 of the sketch section. This rectangle will have four lines and will form a closed loop. 6. Scale the entire sketch by a factor of 0.75. 7. Extrude the sketch by 0.0114 units in the positive z direction. **Instructions for part 2** Shape: A rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center. 1. The final shape is a rectangular prism with dimensions 2x1x0.5 units, with a curved side of radius 0.5 units. This is achieved by combining part 1 and part 2 using the appropriate boolean operations. The final shape will have a rectangular face with a triangular cutout, and a cylindrical hole in the center. The exact position and orientation of these features will depend on the boolean operations used to combine part 1 and part 2.</description>
